TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: I hope we will get a larger crew cabin in the TKS in place of that cargo bay. It's so small that you can't really put very much in there.

The new designs look great Beale!

Thanks!

I hope we will get a larger crew cabin in the TKS in place of that cargo bay. It's so small that you can't really put very much in there.

Depends what you are trying to use it for, I usually but KAS things and whatnot in there For satellites, it is really probably the wrong thing to use.

But yes, there has been a few ideas thrown around about a larger crew cabins.

VA-Full assembly.

More:

Those a while back may remember I was talking about "TantaresMD" a third and small mod, to go alongside Tantares and TantaresLV, that would focus on lunar base building and ISRU.

It was going to use Regolith, but, it seems Regolith is about to become stock, so that's good news!

Edited January 24, 2015 by Beale
See - the problem with all this awesomeness .. I was _JUST_ about to start a new career-mode game, but now I want to wait for the new soyuz and VA to be released lol :-)

See - the problem with all this awesomeness .. I was _JUST_ about to start a new career-mode game, but now I want to wait for the new soyuz and VA to be released lol :-)

It is nice to hear

Well, why I am waiting to finish TKS to release: try not to have too many save-altering releases.

Some may have noticed last parachute was the Soyuz one rescaled, now there is a proper one and a blue (BLUE!) parachute.
Woo! blue chute!

Beale, i just noticed, the new 3-way RCS port for Tantares will be very good for the TKS

can't wait to get my hands on it
On that topic, why do real spacecraft have such bizzare RCS placement? Is there something they know that we don't?

On that topic, why do real spacecraft have such bizzare RCS placement? Is there something they know that we don't?

Generally speaking you don't want to be spraying propellant at the thing you're trying to dock with, so lots of spacecraft have their RCS designed to be able to manoeuvre without firing directly in certain directions. This doesn't matter the slightest in KSP.

At least that's part of the reason.

You should try working from home, I think I have forgotten what a human face looks like

In my case, it's not possible, our Research Institute has a kinda strict policy and an electronic ID cards system, recording how many hours you've been there.

But, on the other hand, I'm on my vacations till February, so no one will force me to go to work, it's just I love being there.

On that topic, why do real spacecraft have such bizzare RCS placement? Is there something they know that we don't?

It's more realistic, the real Soyuz and TKS have it that way.

Like this.

That's the ticket!

Eyes, nose(?), mouth, seems about right.

Beale, i just noticed, the new 3-way RCS port for Tantares will be very good for the TKS

can't wait to get my hands on it

I'm sure you will come up with some nice little things!

On that topic, why do real spacecraft have such bizzare RCS placement? Is there something they know that we don't?
Generally speaking you don't want to be spraying propellant at the thing you're trying to dock with, so lots of spacecraft have their RCS designed to be able to manoeuvre without firing directly in certain directions. This doesn't matter the slightest in KSP.

At least that's part of the reason.

With KSP's all powerful reaction wheels, you can get away with some pretty obscure reaction system setups too.

Take the Tanta Mk1, which could maneuver, dock, all that jazz with just linear thrusters around the skirt.

That reminds me, where is that image originally from?

If I'm not mistaken, an American bible-themed children's programme

I never did choose the avatar for relevancy In fact the original source veers just on the little side of creepy for me.

Edited January 24, 2015 by Beale
Been messing around with the beta VA for a little bit - seems to be working great.
Hmm, what a peculiar program. I swear though, that guy looks a little bit like Walter White to me.

On that topic, why do real spacecraft have such bizzare RCS placement? Is there something they know that we don't?

Along with "where does the exhaust go" placement is also dictated by Center Of Mass. Yaw, pitch and roll want to be far away from the COM for leverage, while translation thrusters want to be placed where there Center of Thrust is *through* the COM.

Beale, the amount of time and effort you have put into this pack is amazing, the quality of modeling is equally fantastic, and the amount of involvement you have had with the users of this mod in this thread has been even better. It's rare you'll see someone who maintains a mod, go through and reply to all the posts and questions people pose in their thread. Keep up the good work man. You're an amazing modder, and an even better member of the community, and it would be a shame to lose you.
